bwg.helpers module¶

Module contents¶

Module for simple helper functions.

bwg.helpers.construct_dict_from_source(fields, source)¶

Construct a new dict from a source dict and catch all KeyErrors, using predefined functions to extract desired values from a source dictionary.

Parameters:fields – Dictionary with fields in the the target dict as keys and functions to extract their desired value .

for these fields from the source dict :type fields: dict :param source: Source dictionary. :type source: dict :return: Target dictionary. :rtype: dict

bwg.helpers.download_nltk_resource_if_missing(resource_path, resource)¶

Download a missing resource from the Natural Language Processing Toolkit.

Parameters:
  • resource_path (str) – Link / path for NLTK resource.
  • resource (str) – Identifier / name of resource (will be used to download the resource if its not found).
bwg.helpers.filter_dict(dictionary, keep_fields)¶

Filter a dictionary’s entries.

Parameters:
  • dictionary (dict) – Dictionary that is going to be filtered.
  • keep_fields (dict) – Dictionary keys that aren’t going to be filtered.
Returns:

Filtered dictionary.
Return type:

dict
bwg.helpers.flatten_dictlist(dictlist)¶

Turns a list of dictionaries into a single dictionary.

Parameters:dictlist (list) – List of dictionaries.
Returns:Flattened dictionary.
Return type:dict
Example: 
>>> dictlist = [{"a": 1}, {"b": 2, "a": 3}, {"c": 4}]
>>> flatten_dictlist(dictlist)
{"a": 3, "b": 2, "c": 4}
bwg.helpers.get_config_from_py_file(config_path)¶

Load a configuration from a .py file.

Parameters:config_path (str) – Path to configuration file.
Returns:Configuration parameters as a dictionary.
Return type:dict
bwg.helpers.is_collection(obj)¶

Check if an object is iterable collection.

Parameters:obj (object) – Object that is to be checked.
Returns:Result of check.
Return type:bool
bwg.helpers.overwrite_local_config_with_environ(config)¶

Overwrite a local configuration file’s parameters by environment variables, if they exist.

Parameters:config (dict) – Current configuration.
Returns:New configuration.
Return type:dict
bwg.helpers.seconds_to_hms(seconds)¶

Convert seconds to hours, minutes and seconds.

Parameters:seconds (int, float) – Number of seconds to be converted.
Returns:Number of seconds as hours, minutes and remaining seconds.
Return type:tuple
bwg.helpers.time_function(out=<_io.TextIOWrapper name='<stdout>' mode='w' encoding='UTF-8'>, is_classmethod=False, return_time=False)¶

Time run time of a function and write to stdout or a log file. Also has some extra functions in case you want to apply it to a ArticleProcessingMixin.

Parameters:out – Output of choice. None will result in no output, sys.stdout to printing to terminal and a path to the

output being appended to a file. :type out: None, str, _io.TextIOWrapper :param is_classmethod: Declare the function being decorated a class method. :type is_classmethod: bool :param return_time: Flag to indicate whether the function’s runtime should be returned alongside the decorated function’s return value in an dictionary. :return: Decorator function. :rtype: func

Example: 
>>> @time_function(return_time=True)
>>> def test_func():
>>>    return 3

>>> test_func()
{"return": 3, "runtime": 3.0994415283203125e-06}
